description: From Latin appositus, past participle of adponere, from ad- + ponere (“to put, place”).

adjectives.description: apposite (comparative more apposite, superlative most apposite)

entries.meaning: Strikingly appropriate or relevant; well suited to the circumstance or in relation to something.
examples: Synonyms: to the point; see also Thesaurus:pertinent

entries.meaning: Positioned at rest in respect to another, be it side-to-side, front-to-front, back-to-back, or even three-dimensionally: in apposition.
examples: In other words, they are used to name, rather than to describe. They are apposite nouns and not adjectives.

entries.meaning: (rare) That which is apposite; something suitable.
